body:
Comment 2: 
I'm not terribly surprised.  6l and 8l work for linking
the kinds of C that cgo generates and hands to gcc,
but not necessarily arbitrary C code compiled with gcc.
My first guess would be something about constructors running.

We don't have the manpower to support this usage.  
If someone else wants to fix the problem, I'd be happy
to review a CL though.
_Labels changed: added **priority-low**, removed **priority-medium**._ _Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **HelpWanted**._
